p: VL is caused by L. (L.) donovani in Asia and central Africa, by L. (L.) infantum in the Mediterranean basin, Middle East, and Central Asia, and by L. (L.) infantum chagasi in South America and Central America ( 31, 68). VL presents symptoms of persistent systemic infection such as fever, fatigue, weakness, loss of appetite, and cachexia. Splenomegaly and/or hepatomegaly also occur, which may lead to anemia due to the persistent state of inflammation and, eventually, death. It is also characterized by progressive suppression of the cellular immune response and hypergammaglobulinemia ( 31, 74).
